fr.polytechtours.prd.multiagent.heuristic

Class Greedy

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.polytechtours.prd.multiagent.heuristic.Greedy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAlgorithm, IEvaluate

    public class Greedy
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAlgorithm, IEvaluate
    Greedy Heuristic for solving the multi-objectif problem.
    Two types of execution are implemented:
    1. to execute the greedy algorithm as the linear combination
    2. to execute the greedy algorithm as the epsilon constraint
    User is responsible to choose one of the two types to run the algorithm.
    Since:
    Mars 10, 2018
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Boyang Wang

      • execute

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> execute()
        Description copied from interface: IAlgorithm
        To execute the algorithm.
        Before executing the algorithm, user should always load the parameters first.
        This method returns only one Pareto solution for certain algorithms, in order to get the pareto front We should always call the method generateParetoFront() in Interface IAlgorithm
        Specified by:
        execute in interface IAlgorithm
        Returns:
        important results got during the execution of algorithm

      • executeEpsilon

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> executeEpsilon()
        to execute the greedy as Epsilon Constraint algorithm
        1. Sort all jobs by using sortEpsilon.
        2. Choose jobs in order to schedule when the constraints are respected. If not feasible, do not schedule this job.
        3. Return the solution
        Returns:
        hashmap with these elements:
        • key:solution, type of value:ArrayList of Job, value:the jobs of class Job which are scheduled

      • executeLinear

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> executeLinear()
        to execute the greedy as the linear combination:
        1. Sort all jobs by using sortLinear.
        2. Choose jobs in order to schedule when the constraints are respected. If not feasible, do not schedule this job.
        3. Return the solution
        Returns:
        hashmap with these elements:
        • key:solution, type of value:ArrayList of Job, value:the jobs of class Job which are scheduled

      • generateParetoFront

        public java.util.Set<ParetoSolution> generateParetoFront()
        Description copied from interface: IAlgorithm
        To generate the pareto front with parameters adapted.

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getMeanDistance

        public double getMeanDistance(java.util.Set<ParetoSolution> frontExact)
        Description copied from interface: IEvaluate
        To calculate the mean distance between two pareto fronts.
        In order to get the mean distance:
        1. For each point on the heuristic front, we try to find the nearest point from the exact front.
        2. Calculate the distance of these two points and add to the total distance
        3. Calculate the mean of the distance.
        Specified by:
        getMeanDistance in interface IEvaluate
        Parameters:
        frontExact - exact front got by an exact algorithm
        Returns:
        the mean distance between two fronts
